name: Arble v. Murray, Appellant, et al.

judges: Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
parties: Arble v. Murray, Appellant, et al.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
This is an action of trespass for damages for personal injuries alleged to have been caused by negligence of defendants. The jury returned a verdict against both defendants for $7,000. We can find no merit in this appeal of the original defendant. The additional defendant did hot appeal. It was necessary to submit the case to the jury. Even defendant’s own testimony suggests his negligence. The judgment is affirmed on the opinion of the learned President Judge of the court below.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Philip N. Shettig, with him Thomas A. Swope, for appellants.
C. Randolph Myers, with him Alton A. McDonald, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Arble v. Murray, Appellant, et al.
Argued March 25,1948.
Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
Philip N. Shettig, with him Thomas A. Swope, for appellants.
C. Randolph Myers, with him Alton A. McDonald, for appellee.
April 12, 1948:
